author: cbs8
title: Goodwill Industries of the Chesapeake to Host Career Fair
text:
Goodwill Industries of the Chesapeake, Inc.
Those looking for work can meet with employers at career fair
BALTIMORE , Oct. 19, Goodwill Industries of the Chesapeake announced today it will host a job fair at its headquarters in Baltimore on Wednesday, October 21, 2015 from 10 am until 1 pm .
As part of its mission of providing job training and placement services, Goodwill is hosting the career fair to help local residents find employment. Employers scheduled to attend include: Senior Life Insurance Company, Symphony Placements, Kennedy Krieger Institute, Allen & Son Moving/Storage, North American Trade Schools, Advantage Sales and Marketing, Wells Fargo, C&S Wholesale Grocers, Horseshoe Casino, Liberty Tax and Essendant.
"We are happy to be hosting another career fair to help those in our community find employment," said Lisa Rusyniak , President & CEO of Goodwill Industries of the Chesapeake, Inc. "Finding a job can be a struggle and our goal is to make it easier for those in need to find employment."
Registration for the career fair is free. For more information, contact Debra Nelson at 410-837-1800 ext. 143 or dnelson@goodwillches.org
WHAT : Goodwill Industries of the Chesapeake Career Fair
WHERE : 222 East Redwood Street, 3 rd Floor, Baltimore, MD 21202
WHEN : Wednesday, October 21, 2015
TIME: 10 a.m. - 1 p.m
About Goodwill Industries of the Chesapeake: Goodwill Industries of the Chesapeake, Inc. provides job training, job placement and other human services for people who are unemployed or face other challenges to employment, including people with significant disabilities. Last year, Goodwill placed 2,506 individuals into jobs. Revenue generated from the sale of donated goods helps fund these programs. For more information on Goodwill, please visit www.goodwillches.org
Media Contact:
Jonathan Balog
VP, Marketing
410-837-1800 ext 175
jbalog@goodwillches.org
